locality: Mountain Warfare Training Camp Michael Monsoor: La Posta area; east of Morena Reservoir and west of La Posta Road; along a dirt road. Atlas Square: T23
habitat: Chaparral with Adenostoma fasciculatum, Quercus x acutidens, Rhus ovata, Eriogonum fasciculatum, Yucca schidigera, Salvia apiana, Sambucus nigra, Eriophyllum confertiflorum; granitic substrates.

locality: Pine Valley, Corte Madera Ranch
Cuyamaca
Pine Hills area, between Magee Flat and Deadman Flat along Eagle Peak Road
habitat: Relatively gently rolling terrain of meadow-like openings surrounded by woodland of Quercus agrifolia and Quercus engelmannii, with scattered Arctostaphylos glauca and Salvia apiana; adjacent rockier slopes previously dominated by chaparral of Adenostoma fasciculatum, Arctostaphylos glauca, etc., but entire area burned in October 2003 fire.

locality: 3 miles east of Julian
habitat: Dry, grassy slope.

locality: Mesa Grande, Nature Conservancy (Wheatly Property), 2 miles W of Morettis Junction (Pala Road & Hwy 79) E of Mesa Grande Road, 2.5 miles south of dam at Lake Henshaw. Square H17
habitat: Granitic substrate on oak woodland hilltop, with Quercus engelmannii, Melica frutescens, Wyethia ovata, Lupinus sp., Bromus tectorum, Erodium botrys.

locality: Warner Springs area, rolling terrain near the Pacific Crest Trail, south of Hwy 79 and west of the Warner Springs Resort
habitat: Grassland dominated by exotic taxa, including Bromus spp., Avena barbata, and Erodium cicutarium, along with natives such as Stipa spp., Aristida, Poa secunda, Opuntia phaeacantha, Eriogonum elongatum, and Gutierrezia sarrothrae.

locality: Wilderness Gardens Preserve c. 3.4 miles east of Pala, south of Hwy 76 along the San Luis Rey River
habitat: Areas along the main trail network from the parking area, along primary driveway within the river bottom to areas of native grasslands on the higher slopes. Oak woodland with Quercus agrifolia, Populus fremontii, Platanus racemosa, Salix ssp., etc., with an understory of Ericameria pinifolia, Toxicodendron diversilobum, Rhamnus ilicifolia, Lepidospartum squamatum, etc., along the river bottom. Chaparral with Adenostoma fasciculatum, Xylococcus bicolor, Arctostaphylos glauca, Ceanothus crassifolius, Salvia mellifera, etc., with scattered pockets of Stipa grasslands on adjacent slopes. Alluvial substrate with sandy loam soil in the river bottom and granitic and/or gabbroic substrates with sandy or clay soils on surrounding slopes; E and N aspects; slopes 0-120%.

locality: Camp Pendleton, central portion of Base, India Training Area, north of Basilone Road and east of Roblar Road, along a trail in a canyon bottom. Square: D5
habitat: Oak woodland with Quercus agrifolia, Malosma laurina, Toxicodendron diversilobum, Salvia apiana, Artemisia californica, Baccharis salicifolia, Platanus racemosa.

locality: hills north of Warner Springs, north Indian Flats Campground of Cleveland National Forest along Road 9S05
habitat: Gentle valley with stream running over shallow granite bedrock slabs. Woodland of Quercus agrifolia and open meadows of Muhlengergia rigens in drainage bottom; slopes with scrub of Adenostoma sparsifolium, Adenostoma fasciculatum, Ceanothus greggii perplexans, Yucca whipplei, Rhamnus ilicifolia, and Arctostaphylos glauca. Understory includes Lonicera subspicata, Eriogonum fasciculatum, Eriogonum wrightii membranaceum, and Garrya flavescens. Stream with scattered Salix lasiolepis and Fraxinus velutina.

locality: Agua Tibia Wilderness Area, NE flank of Agua Tibia Mtn, Arroyo Seco tributary at N base of Eagle Crag, from the Wildhorse Trail E to the main trunk of Arroyo Seco
habitat: Chaparral on slopes of Adenostoma fasciculatum, Ceanothus crassifolius, C. leucodermis, Arctostaphylos glandulosa, Quercus berberidifolia, and Eriodictyon crassifolium. Benches and mesic slopes with dense woodland of Quercus agrifolia.

locality: NW Palomar Mountains: burned areas in the Temecula community of Redhawk, south of the intersection of Redhawk Parkway and Tehachapi Pass Road
habitat: Burned chaparral with Bromus madritensis ssp. rubens, Anagallis arvensis, Erodium botrys, Sidalcea malvaeflora, Sanicula bipinnatifida, etc. Metasedimentary substrate with a sandy loam soil; N-NE aspect; 70% slope.

locality: Agua Tibia Mtns: Redhawk Housing Development, north of the Pechanga Indian Reservation in the hills south of the intersection of Marge Place and Tehachapi Pass (S of Redhawk Parkway)
habitat: Burned in the Temecula fire of May, 1996. Areas of coastal sage scrub and chaparral, with unburned pockets consisting of Eriogonum fasciculatum, Salvia apiana, Lotus scoparius, Artemisia californica, Ceanothus crassifolius. Arkose substrate with a sandy soil; aspects S, E, N; slope 0-120%.

locality: Pauba Ranch [SE of Temecula in Pauba Valley, off Hwy 79]
habitat: Dry, sandy washes with coastal sage scrub.

locality: E of Temecula, Rancho California, SE of intersection of Mesa Verdugo and Calle Vista, N of Pauba Valley and south of Buck Mesa
habitat: Eriogonum fasciculatum dominant, where not cleared. Large lot housing on all surrounding tracts.

locality: Temecula, Long Canyon area west of Del Rey Rd., hills on both sides of gas pipeline route
habitat: Rolling hills with coastal sage scrub and grassland.

locality: Canyon bottom and W-facing slopes above Canada Gobernadora
habitat: Coastal sage scrub and weedy grasslands on slopes, Salix scrub along stream channel and cultivated barley on valley floor.

locality: Wilson Valley Mitigation Bank (Center for Natural Lands Management), NE of Wilson Valley Road and west of Wilson Creek
habitat: Open sage scrub and non-native grassland with granitic outcrops dotting the area. Amazing year for wildflowers, this only one species of many.

locality: State Hwy 74 [Palms to Pines Hwy], 1 mile west of Santa Rosa Mountain Road
Pine Meadow in upper Garner Valley
habitat: At edge of meadow dominated by Artemisia tridentata, Poa secunda, Sitanion, etc., and bordered by chaparral.

locality: Lake Skinner area: hill (1864) east of Skinner Lake at NW end of Tucalota Hills
habitat: Rocky gabbro and granite hill dominated by coastal sage scrub with much Salvia mellifera.

locality: powerline trail west of Juan Diego Flats toward Reed Valley, NW of Cahuilla Mountain
habitat: Chaparral dominated by Adenostoma sparsifolium, A. fasciculatum and Arctostaphylos glauca, with lesser amounts of Prunus ilicifolia, Rhamnus ilicifolia and Eriogonum fasciculatum, plus few small groves of Quercus agrifolia.

locality: southern end of Menifee Valley, between Hwy 215 and Winchester Rd (Hwy 79), south of Los Alamos Rd, rocky slopes flanking Warm Springs Creek
habitat: Disturbed coastal sage scrub in rural residential area, with Artemisia californica, Eriogonum fasciculatum foliolosum, Acourtia microcephala, weedy grasses and annuals.

locality: Grassland at base of Bachelor Mtn. and adjoining chapararal.
habitat: Mild, grassy slope.

locality: Southwestern Riverside County Multispecies Reserve, c. 3 mi NE of Skinner Reservoir
habitat: Coastal sage scrub.

locality: Shipley Multi-species Reserve, blue-line stream on the southeastern flank of Bachelor Mtn.
habitat: Coast live oak riparian forest w/ Quercus agrifolia, Claytonia perfoliata, Urtica dioica holosericea, Solidago californica, Elymus condensatus Verbena lasiostachys, Eleocharis palustris.

locality: Bautista Canyon near Tripp Flats Rd.
habitat: Mixed chaparral with Adenostoma sparsiflora and Artemisia tridentata dominant.

locality: Bundy Canyon, SE of Lake Elsinore; c. 1 road mile (± 0.2 mi) east of Bundy Canyon Road exit from Hwy I-15. About 40 ft. south of road along mapped intermittent blueline stream
habitat: Quercus agrifolia riparian woodland, with Salix laevigata, Platanus racemosa along stream; adjacent N- and W-facing slopes covered by mixed chaparral and coastal sage scrub species.

locality: Menifee, c. 4 mi southeast of Canyon Lake, northeast corner of Bundy Canyon Road and Sunset Avenue
habitat: Flat terrain; non-native grassland with remnant patches of coastal sage scrub including Rhamnus crocea, Rhus aromatica, Eriogonum fasciculatum foliolosum, Adenostoma fasciculatum, Sambucus nigra. Grassland of Avena barbata is disked annually and supports scattered native and weedy annuals.

locality: San Bernardino National Forest, Garner Valley, c. 1.1 air mi southeast of junction of FS Road 6S13 and FS Road 6S04
habitat: Fairly open forest with some chaparral, with Pinus jeffreyi, Adenostoma fasciculatum, Dichelostemma capitatum Nemophila menziesii var. integrifolia, Bromus tectorum, Sphaeralcea ambigua, Lupinus concinnus, Lasthenia californica, Mimulus bigelovii, Anisocoma acaulis, Linanthus lemmonii.

locality: Apple Canyon Rd, 1.5 mi NE of CA-74
habitat: Adenostoma and Arctostaphylos chaparral.

locality: 0.3 mile NW of Keen Camp Summit along CA-74
habitat: Yellow pine forest.

locality: North Domenigoni Hills, north of Diamond Valley, near old mine site above San Jacinto Valley, south of end of Warren Rd.
habitat: Coastal sage scrub on dark metamorphic or volcanic rocks on N and W facing slopes.

locality: Hemet, SE corner of State Street at Gibbel, 1712 ft. hill at east end of Diamond Valley
habitat: Bouldery granitic hill, decomposed granite soil, with coastal sage scrub, and chaparral elements on N slopes; Eriogonum fasciculatum and Artemisia californica dominant.

locality: May Valley c. 1.25 mi SW of Fleming Ranch, slope below May Valley Rd. toward meadow on nameless tributary NW of Hurkey Crk., north of Bonita Vista Rd.
habitat: Moist shaded draw above a meadow; surrounded by dry pine-oak forest.

locality: near Winchester
habitat: Steep, rocky slopes. with Encelia farinosa dominated coastal sage scrub.

locality: Strawberry Creek below Strawberry Valley, c. 2.25 air mi southwest of Idyllwild
habitat: A small creek with forested banks, with Salix, Quercus kelloggii, Calocedrus decurrens, Pinus jeffreyi, Arctostaphyllos pringlei var. drupacea, Rosa californica, Erysimum capitatum, Menta, Eriophyllum confertiflorum, Claytonia, Equisetum, etc.

locality: Temescal Canyon between Horsethief Canyon Rd. and Hostettler Rd., near I-15 Fwy, SE of Corona (Lee) Lake
habitat: Chaparral patches and cleared areas, with Adenostoma fasciculatum.

locality: Temescal Canyon at Alberhill, c. 1/2 mi. west of Lake St. on north side of I-15, near Temescal Canyon Rd. undercrossing, at north edge of Concordia Ranch Rd.
habitat: Loam with much horse manure on disturbed grassy flats with some shrub recovery; moderately steep rocky hillside with coastal sage scrub; assoc. with Artemisia calif., Eriogonum fasc., Dichelostemma, Microseris lindleyi, Daucus pusillus, Bromus, Avena, etc.

locality: hills between Sun City and Perris, low hilltop along powerline corridor c. 1/2 mile west of Goetz Rd., west of Alabaster Loop, above the San Jacinto River upstream of Railroad Canyon Lake
habitat: Rocky loam soil with coastal sage scrub dominated by Eriogonum fasciculatum.

locality: at Chimney Flats on the old control road to Idyllwild
habitat: Chaparral.

locality: Alberhill, unpaved extension of Lake Street, 1.5 km NNE of the intersection of Lake Street and Hwy 15
habitat: Steep hill and roadcut, sparse coastal sage scrub dominated by weedy grasses with Avena barbata, Lotus scoparius brevialatus, Eriogonum fasciculatum foliolosum, Mirabilis laevis. Clay loam soil with granite boulders.

locality: Elsinore Basin; Temescal Valley: SW of Hwy I-15 between Indian Truck Trail and Lake Street exits, c. 0.5 mi east of Glen Eden
habitat: Predominant vegetation is coastal sage scrub dominated by Artemisia californica and Salvia mellifera, grading into Adenostoma chaparral. Quercus agrifolia forest in canyon bottoms.

locality: southeastern Gavilan Hills north of Alberhill, ridge west of dirt extension of Lake St., 0.9 mi. north (358°) of intersection of I-15 and Lake St.
habitat: Ridge top and N-facing 35 ° slope, decomposed granite soil; coastal sage scrub with Salvia apiana, Mirabilis laevis, Artemisia californica, Eriogonum fasciculatum poli., Festuca microstachys, Bromus rubens, B. hordeaceus, etc.

locality: Temescal Canyon, about 0.25 mi west of intersection of Hwy I-15 and Indian Truck Trail
habitat: Chaparral on N-facing slope and flats, patches of oaks in canyon bottom, with grassy openings. Some areas developed as citrus groves. Most specimens collected in vicinity of a S-facing hillside with clay soil. Associated with: Eriogonum fasciculatum, Quercus agrifolia, Q. dumosa, Baccharis glutinosa and Artemisia californica.

locality: Tres Cerritos, c. 3 miles WNW of Hemet, east of the Lakeview Mtns., in central valley among the three peaks
habitat: Coastal sage scrub on granite hills.

locality: Temescal Canyon, along Temescal Canyon Rd. c. 0.35 km NW of El Hermano Rd., c. 0.95 km SE of I-15 crossing
habitat: Sandy mouth of wash and open sandy flats on valley bottom, coarse decomposed granite; annual grassland and sparse scrub with scattered trees, assoc. with Bromus rubens, B. diandrus, Brassica geniculata, Hemizonia kelloggii, Erodium cicutarium, Artemisia dracunculus, A. californica, Quercus agrifolia (prob. planted), Platanus racemosa, Sambucus nigra, Elymus condensatus, etc.

locality: Temescal Canyon, along Temescal Canyon Rd. 1.5 mi. NE (73°) of Glen Ivy Hot Springs, 0-0.4 mi. NE of I-15 crossing
habitat: Canyon bottom, sandy wash benches and slopes.

locality: Foothills, north of Valle Vista. Indian Creek Watershed
habitat: Riparian woodlands along stream, shrublands on surrounding uplands; much of habitat converted to annual grasslands.

locality: Lakeview Mountains; SW of Juniper Flat Road
habitat: Vegetation mostly chaparral, dominated by Adenostoma fasciculatum. Rhus ovata, Quercus berberidifolia occur on N facing sites. Annual grasses common, sometimes dense, away from shrub canopy.

locality: Harford Springs County Park, NW corner of the Gavilan plateau
habitat: Chamise chaparral-Coastal sage scrub-Juniper savanna mosaic

locality: UC Riverside Motte Rimrock Reserve, off Sage Road
habitat: Slopes and gullies in wetter areas of coastal sage scrub, with Phacelia, Eucrypta, Emmenanthe.

locality: Lakeview Mtns, c. 1 air mile SSW of Mt. Rudolph, along powerline road 0.3 mi. east of Contour (Juniper Flats) Rd.
habitat: Coastal sage scrub/chaparral, w/ Adenostoma fascic., Eriogonum fascic. foliolosum, Artemisia calif., Salvia mellif., S. apiana, etc.

locality: Cajalco Road, 3 miles west of Mockingbird Canyon Road, south of Lake Mathews
habitat: Rolling hills, with sandy-gravelly soil. Dominant spp. Eriogonum fasciculatum, Artemisia.

locality: c. 1 mile from junction of Hurley Flats Rd and Idyllwild-Banning Rd
habitat: Chaparral woodland. Dry hillside. Sunny, exposed ridge, decomposed granite. Associated with Quercus, Prunus ilicifolia, Cryptantha, Bromus, Adenostoma.

locality: Oasis de los Osos Preserve of the Nature Conservancy, off Snow Creek Canyon at the north foot of San Jacinto Mountain, l mile west of Snow Creek Village
habitat: Rocky slopes and canyon bottom, with Encelia farinosa, Artemisia californica, Malacothamnus fasciculatus, Eriodictyon crassifolium, Salix exigua, Sarcostemma cynanchoides, etc.

locality: Brown Creek drainage just above the confluence with Twin Pines Creek, near the old Cabazon-Idyllwild Rd.
habitat: Chaparral w/ Adenostoma fasc., Salvia api., Eriogonum fasc. Arctostaphylos, Ceanothus greg., etc. on dry slopes.

locality: Woodcrest area of Riverside, wet canyon 0.25 km ENE of Evening Star Rd., 0.25 km north of Ridge Canyon Dr., above Woodcrest Dam
habitat: N-facing, bouldery, granitic hillsides with coastal sage scrub dominated by Artemisia californica.

locality: San Gorgonio Pass; alluvial fan at the mouth of Snow Creek, between Hwy 111 and Snow Creek Village
habitat: Alluvial fan; creosote bush scrub on rocky alluvium and windblown sand deposits.

locality: Moreno Valley; hills c. 0.7 air mi directly south of 60 Fwy and west of bend in Moreno Beach Drive. Topo Q. shows “Moreno” BM 2067 at top of hill
habitat: Coastal sage scrub dominated by Artemisia californica., Eriogonum fasciculatum, with Scrophularia californica among rocks; N-facing slope w/ high cover of Keckiella antirrhinoides and Toxicodendron diversilobum.

locality: Box Springs Mtns, S-facing slopes near highest peak, right around radio towers.
habitat: Granitic boulders on N slope, within 200 ft. of summit. With Rhamnus ilicifolia, Ceanothus crassifolius, Adenostoma fasciculatum, etc.

locality: Morongo Indian Reservation, Lion Canyon, c. 3.5 miles NNW of Cabazon
habitat: Coastal sage scrub and associated wash. Associates include Eriogunum fasciculatum, Encelia, and Artemisia californica.

locality: Riverside, University of California campus, 1/8 mi. south of Perimeter Road [South Campus Drive]
habitat: Coastal sage scrub, with Artemisia californica, Eriogonum fasciculatum, Salvia apiana and S. mellifera dominant.

locality: Box Springs Mtns.: Coyote Hill (Bench Mark “Versity”, 1386 ft.) and ridge S and SE of the UCR Botanic Garden
habitat: Coastal sage scrub, largely converted to annual grassland; much of the area burned in late spring 1996. Native annuals recovered in good numbers and weedy grasses noticably depressed.

locality: Millard Canyon, near stream crossing of Forest Service Road 2S05, c. 4 miles south of Bear Wallow Spring
habitat: Open sandy soil between shrubs in alluvial scrub dominated by Lepidospartum squamatum.

locality: Riverside; UCR Botanical Garden
habitat: Native coastal sage scrub south of the garden fence.

locality: Morongo Indian Reservation, side canyon east of Hathaway Canyon, tree stand F-06
habitat: Riparian woodland with Platanus racemosa, Fraxinus, Quercus wislizenii, Baccharis salicifolia, etc. Gravelly stream beds with clay-loam soil.

locality: Big Springs Canyon and north on the crest to Two Trees Canyon (S side)
habitat: Associated with Bromus spp., Salvia mellifera, S. apiana, Phacelia minor, Amsinckia menziesii, Erodium cicutarium, etc.

locality: Idyllwild - Banning Road, c. 1 mi from junction with Hurley Flats Road.
habitat: Chaparral.

locality: Morongo Indian Reservation, along dirt road in Hathaway Canyon, near Burro Flats
habitat: Rocky loam in chaparral belt with grassy openings and oak and sycamore woodlands.

locality: Morongo Indian Reservation, flat area cut by small wash, south and west of dirt road to Kitching Peak near junction with East Branch Millard Canyon, tree stand M-04
habitat: Stream bench with Fraxinus dipetala, Quercus wislizenii, Eriogonum fasciculatum, Adenostoma fasciculatum, Juglans, etc.

locality: Morongo Indian Reservation, Hathaway Creek Canyon, NW of Cabazon
habitat: Riparian woodland along stream in deep canyon; with Quercus chrysolepis, Alnus rhombifolia, Salix laevigata, Toxicodendron diversilobum. Woodland stand H03.

locality: East Branch Millard Canyon, along Forest Service Road 4S45
habitat: Rocky canyon bottom in chaparral, with Adenostoma, Quercus wislizenii, Fraxinus dipetala, etc.

locality: Morongo Indian Reservation, Wood Canyon, east of upper Potrero Canyon
habitat: Woodland stand MOR W5.

locality: Morongo Indian Reservation, seep in Wood Canyon, tree stand W-07
habitat: With Baccharis salicifolia, Hydrocotyle, Rorippa nasturtium-aquaticum, Quercus wislizenii, Platanus racemosa, Ranunculus cymbalaria, Rhamnus, etc.

locality: Wildwood Canyon, east end, Camp Wiwoca
habitat: Southern oak woodland, in sandy loam soil.

locality: City of Grand Terrace, east of corner of Van Buren St. and Observation Dr.
habitat: Dry granitic pediment and lower W facing slopes in CSS. Associated with Eriogonum fasciculatum, Artemesia californica, and Heterotheca grandiflora.

locality: head of Banning (San Gorgonio River) Canyon close to the San Bernardino Co. line, 1 mi SE of Oak Glen Conservation Camp
habitat: Chaparral on slopes, canyon bottom with washes and open woodland of Platanus and Quercus.

locality: E side Water Cyn, trib of Wildwood Cyn from N; SW foot Pisgah Pk
east of Yucaipa, Water Canyon, a tributary of Wildwood Canyon from the north. E-facing hillside below the stables (old Hunt Ranch), west of Water Canyon Rd
habitat: Chaparral on hillside, cleared pasture (annual grassland) on alluvium.

locality: Colton: c. 0.3 km north of Little Highgrove (pk 1478), c. 0.8 km west of the corner of Barton Rd. and La Cadena Dr.
habitat: Dry granitic slopes with coastal sage scrub; associated with Encelia farinosa, Guttierezia californica, Solanum xanti, Salvia apiana, Salvia mellifera, and Lessingia filaginifolia.

locality: Banning Canyon
habitat: Roadside in chaparral.

locality: 0.25 to 0.75 miles NE of the Riverside Ave. crossing
habitat: Sandy mesas just up out of the active river channel. Associated with Gilia capitata, Cryptantha muricata, Cryptantha micrantha, Cryptantha intermedia, Eriogonum thurberi, and Pectocarya linearis.

locality: “Wilder’s Canyon Pass,” Fontana city limits, c. 0.5 miles SE of corner of Citrus Ave. and Poplar Ave.
habitat: Gently sloping meadow with sandy soil on mountain pass; very moist in places. Associated with Encelia farinosa, Lessingia filaginifolia, Helianthus annuus, Gutierrezia californica, Phacelia minor, and Calochortus plummerae.

locality: Fontana, east slopes of the Jurupa Hills, south of Jurupa Hills Regional Park, west of Sierra Ave, NE of Mt. Jurupa
habitat: Coastal sage scrub and patches of chaparral on steep granitic slopes.

locality: Jurupa Hills: Mary Vagl Museum and Nature Center, Cypress St., Fontana
habitat: Dry N-facing hillside with large boulders and rock outcrops, along seasonal stream. Assoc. with Amsinckia intermedia, Eucrypta chrysanthemifolia, Rhamnus crocea, Ceanothus crassifolius, Crassula connata, introduced weeds.

locality: Redlands, east side of Sand Canyon Road, near Crafton Hills College
habitat: Disturbed rocky clay, southfacing slopes, full sun. Very degraded chaparral, indications of clearing and pasture use; numerous exotic grasses with remnants of native vegetation. Generally with Bromus spp., Eriogonum fasciculatum, Artemisia californica, Phacelia, Bloomeria.

locality: near Black Rock Spring, Joshua Tree National Monument
habitat: Assoc. with Juniperus, Quercus, Pinus, Eriogonum fasciculatum, and Haplopappus linearifolius.

locality: San Bernardino Nat. Forest, Audubon Society’s “Bearpaw Ranch” Sanctuary, below Forest Falls. Just off Calif. Hwy 38 turnoff to Forest Falls, south of Mill Creek, in vicinity of University Creek
habitat: Pine/oak chaparral; soil sandy/gravelly decomposed granite. Assoc. with Pinus, Quercus, Fraxinus, Acer macrophyllum, etc.

locality: hillside above Mill Creek near Thurman Flats
UC Burns Pinyon Ridge Reserve, c. 1.5 mi east of Pioneertown, NW portion near camping area
habitat: Pinyon-juniper woodland with Yucca brevifolia, Pinus monophylla, Juniperus californica, Quercus turbinella, etc.

locality: UC Burns Pinyon Ridge Reserve, off Skyline Ranch Rd. c. 2 miles (air) ESE of Pioneertown, 1.5 mi. (air) NW of Yucca Valley, between front gate and reserve headquarters at old Burns home
habitat: Flats and bouldery granitic hills, decomposed granite soil; pinyon-juniper woodland with Juniperus, Pinus monophylla, Quercus cornelius-mulleri, Eriogonum fasciculatum, Yucca schidigera, etc.

locality: Little San Bernardino Mtns: Pipes Canyon Preserve; Sorrel Horse Canyon south of Pioneertown Road, along wash and ridge to the south
habitat: Joshua Tree woodland in burn area (within last year); in decomposed granite and alluvial soils.

locality: Glendora Wilderness Park, “Water Pipe Canyon” [=Pavil Cyn] a tributary of Big Dalton Canyon
habitat: Vegetation a mixture of oak woodland and chaparral.

locality: San Dimas Experimental Forest, West Fork San Dimas Canyon, 0.1 to 0.6 mile upstream from confluence with San Dimas Cyn.
habitat: Canyon bottom riparian woodland surrounded by chaparral & coastal sage scrub, last burned 9 years ago, many cultivated plants persisting, dominants incl. Quercus chr., Q. agrifolia, Baccharis salicif., Ceanothus oli., Salix las., Alnus, & Platanus, also w/ Scutellaria tub., Lithophragma het., Plantago lan., Vanegasia, Ageratina, Nerium, Aspidotus ca., Pentagramma tri., etc.

locality: mouth of Keril Canyon, tributary from east of Big Dalton Cyn., just below Big Dalton Cyn. Dam
habitat: Cyn. bottom & surrounding slopes; chaparral & coastal sage scrub, surrounding slight riparian on bottom; dominants include Ceanothus cras., Adenostoma fasc., Artemisia calif., Acmispon glaber, Lonicera subspi., with Phacelia minor, Cryptantha muric., Muhlenbergia micros., Ceanothus oligan., Rhus arom., Nemophila men., Peonia cal., Delphinium parr., Ribes malv., Acer macr., etc.

locality: San Dimas Experimental Forest, Lewis Paul Canyon, above waterfall at junction of Big Dalton Cyn. Rd.
habitat: Canyon bottom with riparian forest surrounded by coastal sage scrub, chaparral and oak woodland, with Ceanothus oliganthus, Salix lasiolepis, Baccharis salicifolia, Rubus californicus, Ageratina adenophora, Ribes, Quercus durata, Nicotiana glauca, etc.

locality: Stoddard Canyon off San Antonio Canyon, north of Upland
habitat: Chaparral and coastal sage scrub; with Eriodictyon trichocalyx, Artemisia californica, etc.

locality: Foothills; mouth of Day Canyon at N end of Etiwanda Ave. Oak Summit project
1.9 mi. south on dirt road from Glen Helen Parkway South, east side of Lytle Creek Wash
habitat: Alluvial slopes; scrub dominated by Artemisia californica, with Lessingia filaginifolia, Ceanothus crassifolius, Gutierrezia californica, Navarretia, Filago gallica, F. californica, Stylocline gnaphaloides, Conyza, Centaurea melitensis, Rafinesquia californica, Tetradymia comosa, Lasthenia gracilis, etc. Site subsequently developed and vegetation destroyed.

locality: [Yucca Valley] along Hwy 247, c. 2.25 mi NW of El Cortez Road
habitat: Volcanic soils with annual grassland on the W side of road, with Erodium cicutarium, Bromus rubens, and Sidalcea. Joshua tree woodland on granitic soils on E side of road, with Yucca brevifolia, Coleogyne ramosissima, and many flowering annuals in sandy openings

locality: Browns Flat, San Dimas Experimental Forest
habitat: Grassy flat surrounded by chaparral and coastal sage scrub; assoc. with Bromus tectorum, Poa secunda, Festuca myuros, Delphinium patens, etc.

locality: Waterman Canyon, l km west of Arrowhead Hot Spring Hotel, at and below the first stream crossing of Old Waterman Canyon Road
habitat: Rocky canyon bottom with cold stream from upper canyon & small hot streams fed by springs along east canyon wall. Many exotics: Nerium oleander, Ricinus comunis, Opuntia ficus-indica, Pennisetum setaceum, etc. Natives: Opuntia littoralis, Salix gooddingii, Baccharis salicifolia.

locality: near Cucamonga, Day Canyon, 0.6 miles NW of gauging station at mouth of canyon
habitat: Canyon bottom at base of E-facing slope; rocky granitic gravel; chaparral and coastal sage scrub, in c. 45 acre burn of 1993.

locality: San Dimas Experimental Forest, Fern Canyon
habitat: Canyon bottom; riparian vegetation surrounded by chaparral.

locality: Northern San Rafael Hills, Liz’s Loop (Edison Road) to Cherry Canyon Fire Road
habitat: Ridgetop, alongside trail, with Acourtia microcephala, Adenostoma fasciculatum, Anthriscus caucalis, Paeonia californica, etc.

locality: near Cucamonga, Day Canyon, 0.9 miles NW of gauging station at mouth of canyon, at small westerly tributary
habitat: Rocky and sandy canyon bottom; coastal sage scrub and chaparral with Eriogonum fasciculatum, Eriodictyon trichocalyx, etc.

locality: Fern Canyon, c. 1.75 mi. east of confluence with upper East Fork San Dimas Canyon
habitat: Riparian vegetation surrounded by chaparral with Umbellularia, etc.

locality: San Sevaine Cow Camp, [west of] Lytle Creek Canyon
habitat: Transition between chaparral and southern oak woodland, with Adenostoma, Ceanothus and Quercus.

locality: North side of slope at saddle of Verdugo Motorway and Brand Park Motorway, on the crest of the Verdugo Mtns
habitat: Assoc. with Cercocarpus betuloides, Keckiella cordifolia, Ceanothus crassifolius, Arctostaphylos glauca, Xylococcus bicolor, etc.

locality: Glen Helen Regional Park, c. 600 m south of Blockbuster Pavilion parking area, between motorcycle racetrack and north parking area
habitat: East-west running canyon bottom; chaparral and coastal sage scrub with Adenostoma fasciculatum, Artemisia douglasiana, Toxicodendron, etc.

locality: [Glen Helen Regional Park] NW end of Muscupiabe
habitat: Shade to sun at edge of chaparral, NW slope of decomposed granite.

locality: north of Glendora, ridge with old firebreak south of Persinger Cyn., from Glendora Mt. Road 0.7 mi. west to San Gabriel Cyn. Dam
habitat: Ridgetop in 2009 burn; chaparral, coastal sage scr., dominants incl. Lupinus ex., Acmispon gl., Bromus di., Erodium c., Festuca my., N & S-facing slopes w/ Heteromeles, Cercocarpus, Adenostoma & Quercus du., Scrophularia, Ribes, Fraxinus, Prunus il., Eschscholzia, Melica, etc.

locality: flats immediately south of Spring Hill, west of FS Rd 2N04 (Barrett-Stoddard Truck Rd.), north of Stoddard Peak
habitat: Grassy area with Avena barbata and Festuca myuros, old disturbance in coastal sage scrub.

locality: 1.1 mi west of Glen Helen Road on FS Road 3N31/Applewhite Road
habitat: Chaparral on burned slopes, with Adenostoma fasciculatum, Quercus dumosa, Arctostaphylos.

locality: Millard Canyon, campground 2 mi N of Altadena, up the stream immediately after Millard campground.
Millard Canyon, 2 mi N of Altadena. First trail on the right immediately before Millard Campground
habitat: Chaparral and riparian areas.

locality: Lytle Creek Road, 2.8 mi. north of Devore Road, Cajon Pass area
c. 12 air mi NW of San Bernardino in lower Lytle Creek Wash, c. 2-4 mi north of Interstate 15
habitat: Openings and terraces in lower chaparral, with Adenostoma, Salvia, Ceanothus, Rhamnus, Eriodictyon, etc.

locality: c. 1 mi west from Baldy Village, 1/2 mi southwest of Cow Canyon Saddle on [Sunset Ridge Fire Road], Sunset Peak
habitat: Chaparral community, dominant plants: Quercus sp., Ceanothus sp.

locality: Lytle Creek, c. 0.5 mile SE of Ranger Station
opposite 24680 Lake Drive, east shore of Lake Gregory
habitat: Yellow pine forest.

locality: Waters Road near Fernwood Drive, Seeley Creek drainage between Valley of Enchantment and Cedarpines Park
habitat: Yellow pine forest with Pinus, Quercus, Calocedrus, and Abies.

locality: Lower Lytle Creek Divide, 0.7 mi. NE of junction of Applewhite Rd. and FS Rd. 3N31
habitat: SE-facing slope; burned summer 1994. Chaparral and coastal sage scrub, with Adenostoma fasciculatum (resprouting), Claytonia, Calandrinia, Collinsia, Phacelia minor, etc.

locality: junction of Lone Pine Canyon & Cajon Canyon, c. 100 m west of Cajon Wash
habitat: Riparian w/ Fraxinus, Alnus rhombifolia, Populus fremontii, Toxicodendron diversilobum, etc.

locality: Miller Canyon next to East fork of West fork Mojave River. east of Silverwood lake.
habitat: Montane forest.

locality: Miller Canyon below Hwy 138, SE of Silverwood Lake, East Fork of West Fork of the Mojave River
Cedar Springs Campground on road to Crestline
habitat: Riparian vegetation on sandy N-facing slope.

locality: upper Big Tujunga Canyon, 1.2 km north of State Hwy 2 (Angeles Crest Hwy) 0.4 km west of Upper Big Tujunga Canyon Road
habitat: Small tributary creek in previously burned Pinus coulteri forest, with Drymocallis glandulosa reflexa, Delphinium patens, Nemophila menziesii integrifolia, Juncus macrophyllus, Arabis eschscholtziana, Galium porrigens, Horkelia rydbergii, Galium porrigens, Scutellaria siphocampyloides; sandy alluvial soil.

locality: Cleghorn Road c. 0.25 mi SE of Cleghorn Pass
habitat: NW-facing roadcut in oak chaparral.

locality: side canyon on W side of Cajon Wash, 0.5 mi. SW of Cajon, 2.1 mi south of jct. of 3N49 and 3N53; 2.9 mi SE of Lone Pine Road and Hwy 138 at Road 3N53; W side of far W railroad
habitat: Marsh area in canyon bottom with chaparral, riparian, coastal sage scrub and southern oak woodland, with Adenostoma fasciculatum, Toxicodendron diversilobum, Salvia mellifera, Rhamnus ilicifolia.

locality: Charlton Flats (= Pine Flats), 13.8 miles east of jct. of Angeles Crest and Angeles Forest highways
habitat: Station Fire burn of 2009, picnic area in shallow cyn. with gentle surrounding slopes; transition zone, dominants incl. Pinus pon., P. jeff., Calocedrus, Quercus chr., Erysimum cap., Eriodictyon par., also w/ Vicia, Allophyllum, Phacelia, Boechera, Leptosiphon, Cryptantha, Trifolium, Saltugilia, Acmispon, Agoseris, Leptosiphon, Nemophila, Plagiobothrys, Tauschia, etc.

locality: west of Cajon Wash and south of Hwy 138, c. 1 mile SSW of Cajon Junction, off FS road 3N49
habitat: Shallow canyon draining toward Cajon Wash, with coastal sage scrub, chaparral and riparian woodland; with Fraxinus velutina, Salix, etc.

locality: Near USFS Rock Camp fire station, c. 2 air miles NNW of Lake Arrowhead North Bay
habitat: Woodland, beneath canopy of Quercus kelloggii and Pinus jeffreyi. Understory dominated by weedy annual grasses (Bromus, Festuca), Castilleja (Orthocarpus) lasiorhynca, Mimulus pilosus, [Plectritis, Heterocodon], etc.

locality: Ralston Peak, on southern ridge
habitat: Chaparral and coastal sage scrub with Adenostoma fasciculatum, Ceanoithus crassifolius, C. integerrimus, Bromus tectorum, etc.

locality: Cajon Pass area, Cleghorn Road (dirt), 2 miles airline east (92°) of Cajon Junction
habitat: Gentle mountain slope of decomposed granite; open chaparral with Adenostoma fasciculatum, Eriodictyon trichoclayx.

locality: road from Devil’s Canyon Wild Area to Azusa, 8-12 mi north of where the road crosses the west fork of the San Gabriel River
Upper Lytle Creek Ridge above Lone Pine Canyon, 1.4 mi. south of Lone Pine Rd. on 3N31, at first switchback, c. 50-1500 m north of road
habitat: Chaparral with Fremontodendron & Ceanothus leucodermis.

locality: upper Horsethief Canyon along the Pacific Crest Trail, below crossing of Forest Service road to Cleghorn Ridge
habitat: Canyon slopes & alluvial flats w/ chaparral of Prunus ilicifolia, Adenostoma fasciculatum, Quercus wislizenii, Ceanothus greggii. Decomposed granite soil.

locality: 8.9 mi east of Big Tujunga Canyon Road, on dirt road 300 yards north of Monte Cristo Ranger Station

just west of San Gabriel Mtns: “Sunshine Canyon” (name not shown on topo): west of San Fernando Road and Hwy I-5 Fwy, just SW of interchange with State Route 14. Sunshine Canyon Landfill property, site proposed for landfill expansion
habitat: Major habitat types include Quercus agrifolia forest, Artemisia-dominated coastal sage scrub, & annual grassland.

locality: Las Flores Ranch area, c. 2 mi. north of intersection of Grass Valley Creek and Hwy 173, c. 2.5 mi. east of the California Aqueduct
habitat: Rocky washes and adjacent slopes and ridgelines. California juniper (Juniperus californica) woodland, with Ceanothus greggii, Eriogonum fasciculatum, Haplopappus linearifolius, H. cooperi, and Salvia dorrii.

locality: Hwy 399 [=SR33] near Casitas Dam
Newhall Ranch, Salt Creek
Baldy Mesa, Lugo-Vincent Powerline (S Cal. Edison), c. 1 mi. west of I-15 and north of Cajon Summit
habitat: Canyon in hills; semidesert chaparral with Quercus john-tuckeri dominant and Adenostoma fasciculatum common.

locality: Placerita Canyon
Piñon Hills area at Sheep Creek, 0.9 mi. south of Hwy 138 at Scrub Oak Rd.
habitat: Broad canyon bottom; pinyon juniper woodland with Juniperus californica, Yucca brevifolia, Y. whipplei cespitosa, Purshia glandulosa, Opuntia echinocarpa, Ephedra nevadensis, Salvia dorrii, Eriodictyon trichocalyx, Eriogonum fasciculatum polifolium, Prunus fasciculatus, Artemisia tridentata, etc.

locality: along Cabin Canyon Creek near the confluence with Aliso Canyon
habitat: Station Fire burn of 2009, canyon bottom and base of east-facing slope; coarse, granular, granitic soil; resprouting chaparral and riparian vegetation, dominants incl. Datisca glomerata, Salix, Artemisia douglasiana, with Castilleja foliolosa, Eriodictyon crassifolium, Carex alma, Rubus ursinus, etc.

locality: Liebre Mtns, north side of northwesternmost end of foothills (of San Gabriel Mtns) between Bouquet Junction and Bonelli Ranch
habitat: Steep north slope.

locality: North slope Baldy Mesa area; large wash just north of Manzanita Wash, off Baldy Mesa Road
habitat: Oak woodland/chaparral with Quercus, Artemisia tridentata, Ceanothus, etc.

locality: 100 m east of mouth of Mescal Canyon, in Mescal Heights area, 50 m east of 237th St. East
habitat: Flood plain; pinyon-juniper woodland with Pinus monophylla.

locality: near Pinon Hills, Mescal Highlands, 0.9 mile west of 237th St. East at Panorama Way, 2.3 mi. S of Ft. Tejon Rd.
habitat: Pinyon-juniper woodland with Pinus monophylla dominant.

locality: Valyermo area, Bobs Gap, east of Bobs Gap Road at base of ridge
habitat: Sandy granitic soil in flat sandy area; Joshua tree woodland with Tetradymia, Chrysothamnus nauseosus, Prunus, Eriodictyon trichocalyx, Yucca brevifolia, Purshia glandulosa, Artemisia tridentata, Lycium cooperi, etc.

locality: Valyermo area, ridge top c. 500 m east of south end of Bobs Gap
habitat: Sandy granitic soil on ridge top; Joshua tree and juniper woodland with Juniperus californica, Ephedra nevadensis, E. viridis, Prunus fascic., Yucca brevifolia, Y. whipplei, Purshia glandulosa, Hymenoclea sals., etc.

locality: Montecito, E fork of Cold Springs burn, 100 yards south of Cold Springs - Hot Springs trail saddle, 1 mi. by trail on E fork of Cold Springs trail, Mountain Drive
habitat: Recent burn.

locality: c. 3.3 km northeast of vAlyermo along bob’s Gap road c. 1.6 km southeast of the aqueduct
habitat: Joshua Tree woodland, with Juniperus californica, Ephedra, Salvia dorrii, Ambrosia salsola, Amsinckia tessellata, Phacelia fremontii, Layia glandulosa.

locality: Newhall Ranch, Castaic Mesas. c. 1 mi SW of Castaic Lagoon at the W edge of a mesa, north of Charlie Canyon
Lake Cachuma County Park. Lake shore, south of boat ramp
habitat: Shady embankments under Quercus. Growing with Viola pedunculata T.& G. and grasses.

locality: southeast end of Marble Mountains, 4.0 mi north northeast of Chambliss at US Hwy 66, in rugged canyon at end of 4WD dirt road at historic mine site
habitat: Very steep limestone canyon walls, with Pleurocoronis pluriseta, Salvia funerea, Peucephyllum schottii, Gilia scopulorum, Cheilanthes parryi.

locality: hills south of Hwy 138, c. 1 mile south of Neenach School, slopes N & E of VABM “Pine”
habitat: Rolling hills with annual grassland dominated by wildflowers, grasses, Erodium, etc.

locality: 1/2 mi. NW of La Liebre Ranch on the south side of Hwy 138, west of the mouth of Tentrock Canyon
habitat: Steep hills, rocky ridge with shallow gravelly loam over bedrock; dense oak scrub with Quercus john-tuckeri and Juniperus californica.

locality: hills south of Hwy 138, c. 1 mile SW of Neenach School, NW of VABM “Pine”
habitat: Open N-facing grassy slopes.

locality: eastern end of Granite Mountains, UC Granite Mountains Desert Research Center, upper Granite Cove in Granite Cove Spring area
habitat: Sandy colluvium derived from granite, on canyon bottom with boulders and Baccharis sergiloides, Muhlenbergia rigida, Salix exigua, Acacia greggii.

locality: Antelope Valley. north side of State Hwy 138 (= Ave. “D”), c. 2 mi. west of Country Store, at town of Neenach (c. 30 mi. west of Hwy I-14).
habitat: Small gravel wash running N/NE in previously plowed agricultural fields. Many exotic & native annuals & perennials, but only a few shrubs. Assoc. w/ Eschscholzia californica, Lupinus excubitus, Bromus rubens, etc.

locality: south side of Oso Canyon, 1/2 mile above the National Cement Plant Rd., 1.2 mi. north of Quail Lake
habitat: Rolling hills cut by canyons, loam soil; annual grassland dominated by Bromus spp.

locality: southeastern foothills, 1.6 mi N of Lancaster Rd/Hwy 138, 1.5 mi S of L.A./Kern Co. border, 1.2 mi E of the CA Aqueduct and 2.14 mi W of 300th St W
habitat: Lower NW-facing 1-5° slope, above NE-tending drainage, with grasses, abundant annuals, and scattered low shrubs; Collinsia bartsiifolia, Monolopia lanceolata, Amsinckia tessellata, Lomatium utriculatum, Lepidum nitidum, Trifolium albopurpureum, Microseris sylvatica, Juncus balticus, Stipa pulchra, Lessingia filaginifolia.

locality: Oso Canyon, c. 2 miles due north of the west end of Quail Lake
habitat: Grassy hillsides in oak woodland.

locality: Tejon Ranch, SE of Lebec, ridge overlooking Interstate 5, about 1.3 miles ENE of Gorman; site PO1086
habitat: Ridge top with extensive grasslands and flower fields.

locality: hills north of Oso Canyon and south of the National Cement Plant
habitat: Grassland on loamy hills with groves of junipers, sometimes dense, on steep or rocky slopes.

locality: Crane Canyon, 1.0 mi. SE (144°) of Castac Lake, 1.7 mi. NE (43°) of Gorman, just S of Kern Co. line
habitat: Rounded hills and large gravelly wash; decomposed granite soil; oak woodland (sparse) and grassland with many annuals.

locality: Oso Canyon, 0.5 mi. SE of Kern Co. line, on Oso Canyon Rd.
habitat: Grassland and sandy wash with Quercus lobata at edge, and shaded north-facing slope with Quercus chrysolepis and Q. wislizeni.

locality: Granite Mountains; Cottonwood Basin, UC Granite Mountains Desert Research Center
habitat: Hillside with Ambrosia dumosa, Yucca schidigera, Coleogyne ramosissima, Lycium andersonii, Acamptopappus sphaerocephala, Cylindropuntia acanthocarpa.

locality: hills c. 3/4 mile east of Castac Lake, east of the pipeline road and west of Dry Field Canyon
habitat: Open grassy meadow surrounded by oak woodland.

locality: hills between Big Sycamore and Little Sycamore canyons, north of reservoir on Calif. Aqueduct
habitat: Rounded hills with soil of decomposed granite and pockets of clay; annual grassland.

locality: Little Sycamore Canyon, 0.65 km NE (33°) of VABM “Cow” on rounded ridge between east and west forks of canyon
habitat: Rolling hills with open oak woodland and grassland with Stipa pulchra, Nemophila menziesii, Thysanocarpus curvipes, Plagiobothrys nothofulvus, annual grasses, Phlox gracilis, etc.

locality: Tejon Ranch, Los Alamos Creek, c. 5 miles NNE of Quail Lake
habitat: Canyon slopes and shaded creek, assoc. with Quercus lobata, Fraxinus velutina, Salix lasiolepis, Juniperus californica.

locality: Bronco Canyon, c. 0.5 mi above confluence with Pescado Creek
habitat: Steep, NE-facing grassy slope, clay loam soil.

locality: Ft. Tejon State Park
San Emigdio Ranch, Tecuya Ridge at end of Digier Road
habitat: Grassland & oak woodland with Quercus lobata.

locality: mouth of Canyon de la Lecheria, north of the end of 290th St. West, head of Pescado Creek
habitat: Grassy N-facing slope at edge of oak scrub of 10-15 ft. tall Q. john-tuckeri, on decomposed granite soil.

locality: San Emigdio Ranch, Tecuya Ridge
habitat: Blue oak grassland.

locality: Tejon Ranch, Bronco Canyon (upper), about 4.5 miles N of the Tehachapi Afterbay
habitat: SW-facing slope with scattered rock outcrops, with mixed Quercus woodland, Ceanothus cuneatus, and Chrysothamnus nauseosus.

locality: Canyon del Gato Montes, above confluence with Canyon del Agua Escondida
habitat: Canyon bottom at toe of N-facing slope; partial shade at edge of oak clump.

locality: head of Canyon del Gato Montes, near foot of road over ridge toward Canyon de la Lecheria
habitat: Gentle alluvial slope; open area with Eriogonum wrightii, E. fasciculatum polif., Festuca micristachys. Bordered by Quercus chrysolepis thickets.

locality: San Emigdio Ranch, 4 km NE of Eagle Rest Peak (near bench mark 4070), along a dirt road 6.5 km north of Antimony Peak
habitat: Blue oak woodland on rocky volcanic ridge and adjacent clay flats and gentle slopes.

locality: Soda Lake Road to Carrizo Plain, c. 0.8 mi. off Hwy 399 [=SR33], near San Luis Obispo County line
Oak Creek Pass on the Tehachapi to Willow Springs Road
Tehachapi to Willow Springs Rd., 2.2 miles south of Highline Rd.
habitat: Grassy slope and adjacent dry stream bed.

locality: Sierra Madre Mountains, Miranda Pine Road, 1.0 mile southeast of CA Hwy 166
habitat: Oak woodland; east-facing, steep slope.

locality: Sierra Madre Mountains, 1.1 mi south of Calif. Hwy 166 on Miranda Pines Road
habitat: Oak woodland with grassy openings and steep roadside banks.

locality: Cummings Valley, along W side of W Valley Blvd. (Rt. 202). between Bear Vally Road and Administration Drive
habitat: Minor sandy-bottomed drainage with Salix exigua, the surrounding area with Ericameria nauseosa scrub.

locality: Cummings Valley, N side of W Valley Blvd. near west intersection with Bertram Circle
habitat: Slopes and canyons with blue oak woodland and grassland dominated by Avena and exotic bromes.

locality: Carrizo Plain; 30.1 mi. NW of Calif. Hwy 166 on Soda Lake Rd., at San Diego Creek Rd near edge of Soda Lake
habitat: Alkaline flat in sagebrush scrub.

locality: Tehachapi Loop, near Keene
Santa Lucia Range NE of Lopez Lake; 4.8 mi. N of Hi Mountain Road along Upper Lopez Lake Road. Vicinity of Wittenberg and Huffs Hole Creeks
habitat: Chaparral with shaded, rocky banks, open grassy areas, and riparian zones.

locality: 1.8 mi. south of American Canyon Campground
Pozo Road, 0.9 mi east of Hi Mountain Road, north side of Garcia Mountains
habitat: Grazing land, mostly open, but with scattered oaks.

locality: north of Carrizo Plain National Monument, along Soda Lake Road between College and Belmont Streets
habitat: Meadow with clay openings, saline areas dominated with Distichlis; also Erodium cicutarium and Atriplex shrubs.

locality: c. 6 mi. west of Soda Lake Rd along Calif. Hwy 58
habitat: Beginning of hills & chaparral

locality: south of Shandon, at junction of Shell Creek Road and CA Hwy 58
habitat: Foothill woodland area with riparian zone and open grassy fields. No surface flow in the stream. Grassland areas lightly grazed.

locality: Lake Isabella, Calif. Hwy 178, 2 miles west of Weldon
Alta Sierra, 8 miles north of Lake Isabella off Hwy 155, Greenhorn Mtns, Sequoia National Forest
habitat: White fir / incense cedar phase of yellow pine forest. East exposure.

locality: Jolon Road cutoff
habitat: With Lamarckia aurea, Lasthenia, Claytonia perfoliata, Schismus.

locality: 8.4 miles S of King City along G-14
habitat: Oak woodland.

locality: Los Padres National Forest: Arroyo Seco Rd. between Arroyo Seco Campground and G16
habitat: Roadside.

locality: Garrapata State Park, off State Hwy 1 (=Pacific Coast Hwy), north of lighthouse at Point Sur and south of Carmel Highlands
habitat: Riparian redwood forest along creek channel, coastal sage scrub on steep hillsides and type-converted annual grassland on ridgetops.

locality: Carmel Highlands, above Yankee Point
habitat: Decomposed granite formation. Open sunny slopes, among grass and low, scrubby Eriogonum parvifolium.

locality: Watts Valley Rd., 4 miles north of junction with Trimmer Springs [=Maxson] Rd
habitat: Foothill woodland.

locality: Bass Lake Road, 2.2 miles southeast of the junction with CA Hwy 41
habitat: Pine forest near the south end of Bass Lake.

locality: San Leandro Creek
Jesus Maria Road, 2.4 miles southeast of its junction with CA-26; beside Jesus Maria Creek
habitat: Cottonwood creekside area adjacent to oak woodland.

locality: E of Sacramento, SW of Shenandoah Valley; along Calif. Hwy 49, c. 4.5 mi north of Plymouth
habitat: Oak woodland.

locality: along Bell Road beside Plymouth Creek just east of Calif. Hwy 49 in the vicinity of Enterprise
habitat: Chaparral with oaks.

locality: Howell Mountain Plateau, c. 1 km west of Anguin; McCrane property
habitat: Vinyard conversion.

locality: Perry Creek Road, 0.1 mile south of its junction with Slug Gulch Road, 0.4 mi. northeast of Fairplay
habitat: Oak area with farm openings and much chaparral.

locality: Between N and Middle forks of Cosumnes River; Junction of Sand Ridge Road and Cutaway Lane, 2.1 mi SW of Somerset
habitat: Oak woodland and small meadow beside flowing creek.

locality: Stewarts Point-Skaggs Springs Rd, 16.7 miles west of intersection with Rockpile Rd, Wolf Creek drainage
habitat: Steep northwest-facing slope, roadcut with eroding shale and brown clay; Quercus garryana woodland, grassland understory, w/ Toxicodendron diversilobum, Ranunculus occidentalis, Lathyrus vestitus, etc.

locality: 4 miles east of Hopland, Hopland Field Station, Little Buck Pasture
habitat: Growing on a slope in a cultivated field, with oak and madrone surrounding.

locality: Magnolia Road, 3.0 miles east of its junction with CA-49
habitat: Low hills with grassy slopes and many oaks.

locality: Blue Oak Campground, Indian Valley Reservoir. 2.5 mi past intersection of access road and Walker Ridge Road
Bear Valley.
habitat: Serpentine soil.

locality: Southfork Rd., 12 mi south of Hwy 299
habitat: Rocky, grassy S-facing slope, beneath Cercocarpus betuloides.

locality: Near the old Hwy 299 on W side of Berry Summit
habitat: Open hill - grassland.
